intro: Lesquerella paysonii, commonly known as Payson's lesquerella, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Lesquerella paysonii produces capsule fruits that contain oily seeds, which are used in the production of certain industrial oils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
